messages.subject: Re: Just wanted to throw this out ther
messages.msgSnippet: ... Read those articles again.  They re right!  Actually,  both of my children learned to read when they were still in ps,  but I have one early reader and one
messages.messageBody:
> I'm really curious about unschooling and learning to read. My 7yod does not
> yet read (much...she can read a few words). I've read many articles saying
> things like: a) just keep reading to the child and s/he will learn to read.
> b) When s/he's ready, she will read, whether it's at age 4 or even as late
> as nine or ten.
>
Read those articles again. They're right! Actually, both of my
children learned to read when they were still in ps, but I have one
early reader and one late. My late reader was sent to a special
reading teacher, etc. etc. etc. All this caused was a lot of
frustration and she still learned to read when she was ready.
Finally after homeschooling, she does love to read even more than my
early reader. I've had unschooling friends whose kids began to read
proficiently as late as their early teens. Relax and enjoy reading
to her. I wish I still had a child that enjoyed being read to.

Diane from KS
jagwirtz@...
